item.title: Colleen add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "If people sat outside and looked at the stars each night, I'll bet they'd live a lot differently. " -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Remember, Hope is a good thing, maybe the best of things, and no good thing ever dies." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "He had never before felt so self-consciously young, nor experienced such appetite, such impatience for the story to begin." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Your hair is winter fire January embers My heart burns there, too." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "I promise to always turn back toward you," -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Colleen add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Her heart was a secret garden and the walls were very high." -- William Goldman

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Marisha Pessl
item.description: "The Shadow is what people are hunting throughout the tale. Or else it can dog the hero, refusing to leave him alone. It's a potent force that bewitches as much as it torments. It can lead to hell or heaven. It's the hollow forever inside you, never filled. It's everything in life you can't touch, hold on to, so ephemeral and painful it makes you gasp. You might even glimpse it for a few seconds before it's gone. Yet the image will live with you. You'll never forget it as long as you live. It's what you're terrified of and paradoxically what you're looking for. We are nothing without our shadows. They give our otherwise pale, blinding world definition. They allow us to see what's right in front of us. Yet they'll haunt us until we're dead." -- Marisha Pessl

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were, but without it we go nowhere." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Home is watching the moon rise over the open, sleeping land and having someone you can call to the window, so you can look together." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Elmore Leonard
Colleen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Colleen add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Inconceivable!" "You keep using that word. I do not think it means what you think it means." -- William Goldman

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "A classic is a book that has never finished saying what it has to say." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "Mr. Powell raised an eyebrow. 'I'm a librarian,' he said. 'I always know what I'm talking about." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Maybe there aren't any such things as good friends or bad friends - maybe there are just friends, people who stand by you when you're hurt and who help you feel not so lonely. Maybe they're always worth being scared for, and hoping for, and living for. Maybe worth dying for too, if that's what has to be. No good friends. No bad friends. Only people you want, need to be with; people who build their houses in your heart." -- Stephen King

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Christopher Golden
item.description: "The dream dissipated like smoke, and she tried so hard to hold it inside her heart and her memory, but like all dreams, it had never been meant to keep." -- Christopher Golden

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "...don't read anything except what destroys the insulation between yourself and your experience..." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Colleen add a quote by Jun'ichirō Tanizaki
item.description: "Were it not for shadows, there would be no beauty." -- Jun'ichirō Tanizaki
